channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2723] Allison Stokke the Hottest Athlete? Google it
item.description: Allison Stokke the Hottest Athlete? Look at what Google thinks - BetterTrades Sports

item.title: [+2253] PSA: Hollywood Speaks Out to Help Health Insurance Companies
item.description: Will Ferrell, Jon Hamm, Olivia Wilde and friends speak out to protect insurance companies.

item.title: [+1912] The Obama Plan in 4 Minutes
item.description: Learn the basic principles of President Obama's health insurance reform plan as presented to Congress on September 9, 2009.

item.title: [+1714] 10 Best Things We'll Say to Our Grandkids
item.description: Back in my day, we only needed 140 characters.

item.title: [+1355] Man Blows Brains Out While Teaching Girlfriend Gun Safety
item.description: Given the name or the victim and the stupidity of the following incident, you'd almost think this story was made up.

item.title: [+1339] Immortality only 20 years away says scientist
item.description: Scientist Ray Kurzweil claims humans could become immortal in as little as 20 years' time through nanotechnology and an increased understanding of how the body works.

item.title: [+1166] AT&T Wants You to Pay Extra to Fix Their Own Failures
item.description: AT&T's network is basically a huge failure. And if you want to fix their incompetence in your area, you'll need to pay an additional $20 a month for a 3G MicroCell. I call bullshit.

item.title: [+1162] The Most Controversial Magazine Covers of All Time
item.description: A collection of magazine covers that have stirred up controversy through the years.

item.title: [+972] Russian Billionaire Installs Anti-Photo Shield on Huge Yacht
item.description: Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich has a rather curious new addition built in to his latest oversized yacht. Lasers sweep the surroundings and when they detect a CCD, they fire a bolt of light right at the camera to obliterate any photograph.

item.title: [+964] GOPer: If Boys Know Porn Turns Them Gay, They Won't Buy It
item.description: This weekend at a gathering of conservative activists, Sen. Tom Coburn's (R-OK) chief of staff Michael Schwartz argued that "all porn is homosexual porn, because all pornography turns your sexual drive inwards," adding that if boys know porn will make them gay, they'll never touch it, taking advantage of what Schwartz sees as a natural homophobia.

item.title: [+883] Hold up, I'll let you finish but...[Pic]
[+863] Iowa Gay Marriage Poll: 92% Not Effecting Their Lives.
item.description: One of the most commong arguments against marriage equality is that the legalization of gay marriage threatens the institution of traditional marriage. Apparently, it's not a good argument.

item.title: [+759] 6 Facebook Hack Codes And Tips To Show Off Your Geeky Skills
item.description: a list of the top 6 Facebook “hack” codes and tips to other Facebook enthusiasts out there.

item.title: [+734] Religious Right - "Looking at Naked Women Turns You Gay!"
item.description: Michael Schwartz, a long-time right-wing activist who's served as Sen. Tom Coburn's (R-Okla.) chief of staff since 2005, spoke at a breakout session at the Values Voter Summit on Saturday, and attacked pornography. "All pornography is homosexual pornography, because all pornography turns your sexual drive inwards." WTF!!

item.title: [+692] FCC Chairman wants network neutrality, wired and wireless
item.description: FCC Chairman Julius Genachowski waded directly into the network neutrality fight today, launching a new proceeding designed to turn the FCC's existing "principles" into "rules"—and to add two more. The rules would apply equally to wired and wireless connections.

item.title: [+685] Fan makes epic GOOOOOOAL for his team
[+684] Oktoberfest, 2009 (PICS)
item.description: The 176th Oktoberfest started on Saturday the 19th, kicked off by Munich Mayor Christian Ude, tapping the first keg with a cry of "O'zapft is!". Collected here are a few photographs from the first couple of days of Oktoberfest 2009. (

item.title: [+668] 12 Things You May Not Know About Judaism
item.description: While there's a lot to learn (just think of Jews who've studied the Torah over the centuries), every journey starts somewhere. With that in mind, here are 12 things most people don't know about Judaism. From sacred time to sacred sex, you may be surprised by what you learn.

item.title: [+656] Glenn Beck Was For the Bailouts Before He Was Against Them
item.description: Exactly one year ago today, Beck publicly endorsed the bank bailouts. "The 'Real Story' is: The $700 billion that you're hearing about now is not only, I believe, necessary, it is also not nearly enough, and all of the weasels in Washington know it."

item.title: [+633] NetFlix Everywhere: Sorry Cable, You're History
item.description: Today, nearly 3 million users access Netflix's instant streaming service, watching an estimated 5 million movies and TV shows every week on their PCs or living room sets. By the end of 2009, nearly 10 million Netflix-equipped gadgets will be hanging on walls and sitting in entertainment centers. And CEO Reed Hastings says this is just the beginning
